meanings.definition: Relating to or involving the measurement of radiation.
meanings.sent1: The radiometric device helped scientists measure the amount of radiation in the environment.
meanings.sent2: The lab technician used a radiometric tool to check the radiation levels in the room.
meanings.sent3: The radiometric gadget beeped loudly whenever it detected any radiation, making it sound like a tiny alarm clock.
meanings.sent4: Her eyes were like radiometric sensors, always able to detect even the slightest hint of radiation.
meanings.sent5: The radiometric equipment glowed softly as it accurately measured the radiation present.

meanings.definition: Using radioactive substances to determine the age of rocks or other materials.
meanings.sent1: The radiometric in the geology lab was essential for dating the ancient rocks.
meanings.sent2: Scientists rely on radiometric to accurately estimate the age of fossils.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous student tried to use the radiometric to guess the age of his lunch sandwich.
meanings.sent4: Her expertise in radiometric made her the go-to person for dating archaeological finds.
meanings.sent5: The radiometric revealed the true age of the artifact, unlocking its historical significance.
